document_data.Druid Circles:
{{Main|Druid circle}}
In addition to the loose fellowship shared by all druids, druids were divided into more localized organizations known as circles, many of which shared certain common beliefs and abilities.
document_data.Notable Druids:
* [[Arundel]], the 13{{th}} century [[DR]] human archdruid of [[Kuldahar]].
* [[Cernd]], a [[shapeshifter]] during the mid–14{{th}} century DR that traveled throughout the [[Lands of Intrigue]].
* [[Christine Dragonsbane]], Queen of [[Damara]], married to [[Gareth Dragonsbane]], and the matriarch of the [[Dragonsbane]] dynasty.<ref>
* [[Elanee]], a [[wood elf]] druid from the [[Mere of Dead Men]] that traveled alongside the [[Kalach-Cha]] in the late 14{{th}} century DR.<ref name=NWN2">
* [[Faldorn]], the [[Uthgardt]] human leader of the [[Shadow Druids]].
* [[Iselore]], the [[half-elf]] archdruid of Kuldahar that succeeded Arundel.
* [[Jaheira]], a half-elf [[Circle of the Land]] druid and an agent of the [[Harpers]] that played a role in the events leading up to the [[Bhaalspawn crisis]].
* [[Pikel Bouldershoulder]], the green-bearded [[dwarf|dwarven]] druid of the [[Snowflake Mountains]] that kept a pet [[squirrel]] named [[Percival]].
* [[Robyn Moonsinger]], the [[Ffolk]] human Queen and Great Druid of the [[Moonshae Isles]] in the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century DR.
* [[Newander]], a rather shy druid that venerated the Oak Father [[Silvanus]].
* [[Halsin]], the wood elf archdruid of the [[Emerald Grove]] that faced infiltration of the Shadow Druids in the late 15{{th}} century DR
